summary: This document is an email chain from July 3, 2020, between a potential witness/victim (W) and FBI officials regarding the Epstein investigation. The individual, who identifies as a member of SAG-AFTRA and PGA, reports being raped 20 years prior and offers information that may help connect dots in the case. FBI officials arrange for a case agent to contact the individual for an interview.

events.title: Reported rape of W
events.description: W mentions experiencing a rape 20 years prior to the 2020 correspondence and had previously tried to seek justice but the climate wasn't conducive.

events.title: FBI contact initiated regarding Epstein investigation
events.description: W emails the FBI offering information potentially linked to the Epstein case. FBI officials respond and arrange for a case agent from the New York task force to make contact.

keyFacts: A potential witness/victim (W) contacted the FBI in July 2020 offering information about a rape from 20 years prior that may connect to the Epstein investigation.
The individual expressed a long-term sense of threat, stating 'I have lived under provable online threat for over 20 years.'
The FBI's New York Field Office, specifically the Criminal Division and an Epstein Taskforce, was handling the outreach and planned to have a case agent make contact.
The correspondence highlights the ongoing investigative efforts and public outreach related to the Epstein case years after his death.
